title: Russia tracks down migrants to fill its army's ranks
summary: To reinforce its troops in Ukraine, and avoid an unpopular new wave of military mobilization, the Kremlin has been arresting and deceiving foreign workers, going as far as raiding mosques for them.

title: UN General Assembly passes resolution for humanitarian truce in Gaza
summary: The 193-member world body adopted the non-binding resolution by a vote of 120-14 with 45 abstentions. France voted for the measure; Germany, Italy and Britain abstained; while Austria and the United States voted against it.

title: With two aircraft carriers, the US wants to create a naval bubble around Israel
summary: Following the dispatch of the USS Gerald R. Ford, the United States announced the arrival of the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower in the Mediterranean within the next few days. This force of over 15,000 sailors is primarily aimed at deterring regional escalation with Iran.

title: Indonesia: President Joko Widodo selects a former rival to secure his political legacy
summary: Former general Prabowo Subianto, whose career has been marred by human rights violations during the dictatorship, is launching a campaign for the 2024 presidential election with the current head of state's son as his vice-presidential candidate.

title: French government unveils tough measures four months after riots
summary: But apart from some firm measures on juvenile justice and parental accountability, Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne's announcements were either not new or unspecific.

title: Rugby World Cup: England defeat Argentina to finish in third place
summary: Captain Owen Farrell kicked 16 points for England as clung on to beat Argentina 26-23 on Friday.

title: Wild chimpanzees also experience menopause
summary: This is a first for a wild primate. In the community of Ngogo, Uganda, females continue to live up to 10 years after the end of their fertile period, according to a study published Friday in the journal 'Science.'

title: Afghanistan: ISIS claims responsibility for attack that left four dead in a Kabul shopping center
summary: On Thursday, an explosion rocked the predominantly Hazara Shiite neighborhood of Dasht-e-Barchi in Kabul, where this minority community has frequently experienced attacks in the Sunni-majority country.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Macron calls for 'humanitarian truce'
summary: The president also said France wants to evacuate its citizens trapped in the Gaza Strip.

title: Mexican city of Acapulco devastated by Hurricane Otis
summary: Everything from cars and sailboats to power poles, roofs and trees seemed to go flying as the hurricane passed through, with winds exceeding 300 km/h. According to initial estimates, 27 people died and 80% of hotels were destroyed.

title: Crypto entrepreneur Bankman-Fried denies fraud in court
summary: While the FTX founder acknowledged some of his failures early in his testimony in federal court on Friday, he has denied that he defrauded anyone and pled not guilty.

title: Israel's economy hit hard by war against Hamas
summary: Since the October 7 attack, all sectors in Israel, including construction, tech, agriculture and textiles, have been affected by labor shortages.

title: European leaders torn between the fronts in Ukraine and the Middle East
summary: At a Council meeting on Thursday, the leaders of the European Union, with the exception of Slovakia and Hungary, reaffirmed their support for Kyiv, but spent most of their time drafting a joint declaration on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: In Kinshasa, Mélenchon affirms his 'fraternity' with the DRC against Rwanda's 'abuses'
summary: On a visit to the Democratic Republic of Congo, the French left-wing politician lent his support to the authorities and denounced Kigali's 'expansionist aims.'

title: 2024 US Election: Dean Phillips announces Democrat nomination bid
summary: Phillips, a Minnesota congressman, has argued that Biden may be unable to beat Trump again and has encouraged other primary challengers: 'I think it's time for a new generation.'

title: French minister Darmanin looks to strengthen judicial cooperation between France and the UAE
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin met with his Emirati counterpart in Dubai, on Wednesday, October 25. The Gulf country is regularly singled out as a haven for members of organized crime.

title: Retired Colombian army officer sentenced in US over 2021 assassination of Haiti's president
summary: He is the second of 11 suspects charged in Miami with conspiring and supporting a plot to kill the Haitian president. Both suspects have received life prison sentences.

title: On Moscow visit, Hamas leaders rule out release of hostages without a ceasefire
summary: On Thursday, Russia's deputy foreign minister met with Hamas leaders. Since October 7, Moscow has clearly adopted an anti-Israel stance in the hope of weakening the West's support of Ukraine.

title: Maine mass shooting suspect found dead according to authorities
summary: The suspect in a mass shooting in the US state of Maine has been found dead of a self-inflicted gunshot wound, US media reported Friday, after an intense manhunt that lasted more than two days.

title: Since Hamas attacks, Israel's Palestinian minority dreads reprisals: 'I'm afraid we'll take 10 steps backward'
summary: Since the murderous Hamas raids, the minority has been treated like a 'fifth column,' as in Haifa, a large 'mixed city,' where a significant number of both Jews and Arabs live. Students and employees have been punished, suspended or dismissed. Their online speech is monitored.

title: Switzerland: Outspoken xenophobia gains ground at the ballot box
summary: Having won the parliamentary elections on Sunday, October 22, the populist SVP party refuses to accept the far-right label, which aligns with its ideology. Its communication, however, is hardly subtle.

title: US, China pave way for a Biden-Xi meeting next month
summary: President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping have agreed to meet on the sidelines of next month's Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco, according to a US official familiar with the planning.

title: Cinemed film festival provides counterprogramming to war in the Middle East
summary: The shadow of the conflict between Israel and Hamas hangs over the Mediterranean film festival in Montpellier, which invites Palestinians and Israelis alike to present their work.

title: Spanish Catholic clergy sexually abused more than 200,000 children, report estimates
summary: Presenting the findings, Spain's national ombudsman criticized the church's response to abuse and recommended the establishment of a reparation fund.

title: Israel says it 'hit 150 underground targets' in night of intensive attacks targeting Hamas tunnels
summary: No official death toll was given after Friday night's offensive that also knocked out all of Gaza's communication networks, but the level of bombardment was unprecedented since the start of the war on October 7.

title: Israel accelerates its military operations in the Gaza Strip
summary: The army claims to have carried out 150 strikes on underground infrastructures used by Hamas in the north of the Gaza Strip. The scale of attacks  remained difficult to gauge, especially as communications in the Palestinian enclave have been cut off since Friday.

title: At least 32 dead in Kazakhstan coal mine fire
summary: Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said on Saturday that steel giant ArcelorMittal was the 'worst' company in 'our history' after a fire at a mine owned by the Luxembourg-listed group killed more than 32 people.

title: Iran's latent front in Syria poses a real threat to Israel
summary: Pro-Iranian militias have strengthened their presence in the south of the country, posing an additional threat to Israel in the event of a ground offensive in Gaza.

title: Macron proposes a 'maritime humanitarian coalition' to help civilians in Gaza
summary: At the end of the European Council on Friday, the French president discussed the possibility of transferring patients and delivering medical supplies and food to Gaza. He assured that 'contacts' had been established with the Israeli authorities.

title: Gaza death toll: A highly political controversy
summary: In response to the White House's accusations of manipulation of the death toll in Gaza from Israeli bombing, Hamas has published a list of the names of more than 7,000 people killed since October 7.

title: The training camp where Ukrainians prepare for combat: 'Here, they can make mistakes'
summary: Some young civilians, who fear a mobilization will be 'inevitable,' are enrolling in paid training programs that teach them military combat skills.
